intro: Caraipa rodriguesii, commonly known as the Rodrigues starling tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are edible and contain a single seed. It is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in sandy soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
